verses.verse: Listen <WH8085>, O isles <WH339>, unto me; and hearken <WH7181>, ye people <WH3816>, from far <WH7350>; The LORD <WH3068> hath called <WH7121> me from the womb <WH990>; from the bowels <WH4578> of my mother <WH517> hath he made mention <WH2142> of my name <WH8034>.

And he hath made <WH7760> my mouth <WH6310> like a sharp <WH2299> sword <WH2719>; in the shadow <WH6738> of his hand <WH3027> hath he hid <WH2244> me, and made <WH7760> me a polished <WH1305> shaft <WH2671>; in his quiver <WH827> hath he hid <WH5641> me;
And said <WH559> unto me, Thou art my servant <WH5650>, O Israel <WH3478>, in whom I will be glorified <WH6286>.

Then I said <WH559>, I have laboured <WH3021> in vain <WH7385>, I have spent <WH3615> my strength <WH3581> for nought <WH8414>, and in vain <WH1892>: yet surely <WH403> my judgment <WH4941> is with the LORD <WH3068>, and my work <WH6468> with my God <WH430>. my work: or, my reward

And now, saith <WH559> the LORD <WH3068> that formed <WH3335> me from the womb <WH990> to be his servant <WH5650>, to bring <WH7725> Jacob <WH3290> again <WH7725> to him, Though Israel <WH3478> be not gathered <WH622>, yet shall I be glorious <WH3513> in the eyes <WH5869> of the LORD <WH3068>, and my God <WH430> shall be my strength <WH5797>. Though: or, That Israel may be gathered to him, and I may, etc

And he said <WH559>, It is a light thing <WH7043> that thou shouldest be my servant <WH5650> to raise up <WH6965> the tribes <WH7626> of Jacob <WH3290>, and to restore <WH7725> the preserved <WH5341> <WH5336> of Israel <WH3478>: I will also give <WH5414> thee for a light <WH216> to the Gentiles <WH1471>, that thou mayest be my salvation <WH3444> unto the end <WH7097> of the earth <WH776>. It is: or, Art thou lighter than that thou shouldest, etc preserved: or, desolations

Thus saith <WH559> the LORD <WH3068>, the Redeemer <WH1350> of Israel <WH3478>, and his Holy One <WH6918>, to him whom man <WH5315> despiseth <WH960>, to him whom the nation <WH1471> abhorreth <WH8581>, to a servant <WH5650> of rulers <WH4910>, Kings <WH4428> shall see <WH7200> and arise <WH6965>, princes <WH8269> also shall worship <WH7812>, because of the LORD <WH3068> that is faithful <WH539>, and the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478>, and he shall choose <WH977> thee. whom man: or, that is despised in soul

Thus saith <WH559> the LORD <WH3068>, In an acceptable <WH7522> time <WH6256> have I heard <WH6030> thee, and in a day <WH3117> of salvation <WH3444> have I helped <WH5826> thee: and I will preserve <WH5341> thee, and give <WH5414> thee for a covenant <WH1285> of the people <WH5971>, to establish <WH6965> the earth <WH776>, to cause to inherit <WH5157> the desolate <WH8074> heritages <WH5159>; establish: or, raise up

That thou mayest say <WH559> to the prisoners <WH631>, Go forth <WH3318>; to them that are in darkness <WH2822>, Shew <WH1540> yourselves. They shall feed <WH7462> in the ways <WH1870>, and their pastures <WH4830> shall be in all high places <WH8205>.

They shall not hunger <WH7456> nor thirst <WH6770>; neither shall the heat <WH8273> nor sun <WH8121> smite <WH5221> them: for he that hath mercy <WH7355> on them shall lead <WH5090> them, even by the springs <WH4002> of water <WH4325> shall he guide <WH5095> them.
And I will make <WH7760> all my mountains <WH2022> a way <WH1870>, and my highways <WH4546> shall be exalted <WH7311>.
Behold, these shall come <WH935> from far <WH7350>: and, lo, these from the north <WH6828> and from the west <WH3220>; and these from the land <WH776> of Sinim <WH5515>.

Sing <WH7442>, O heavens <WH8064>; and be joyful <WH1523>, O earth <WH776>; and break forth <WH6476> into singing <WH7440>, O mountains <WH2022>: for the LORD <WH3068> hath comforted <WH5162> his people <WH5971>, and will have mercy <WH7355> upon his afflicted <WH6041>.
But Zion <WH6726> said <WH559>, The LORD <WH3068> hath forsaken <WH5800> me, and my Lord <WH136> hath forgotten <WH7911> me.

Can a woman <WH802> forget <WH7911> her sucking child <WH5764>, that she should not have compassion <WH7355> on the son <WH1121> of her womb <WH990>? yea, they may forget <WH7911>, yet will I not forget <WH7911> thee. that: Heb. from having compassion
Behold, I have graven <WH2710> thee upon the palms of my hands <WH3709>; thy walls <WH2346> are continually <WH8548> before me.
Thy children <WH1121> shall make haste <WH4116>; thy destroyers <WH2040> and they that made thee waste <WH2717> shall go forth <WH3318> of thee.

Lift up <WH5375> thine eyes <WH5869> round about <WH5439>, and behold <WH7200>: all these gather themselves together <WH6908>, and come <WH935> to thee. As I live <WH2416>, saith <WH5002> the LORD <WH3068>, thou shalt surely clothe <WH3847> thee with them all, as with an ornament <WH5716>, and bind <WH7194> them on thee, as a bride <WH3618> doeth.

For thy waste <WH2723> and thy desolate places <WH8074>, and the land <WH776> of thy destruction <WH2035>, shall even now be too narrow <WH3334> by reason of the inhabitants <WH3427>, and they that swallowed thee up <WH1104> shall be far away <WH7368>.

The children <WH1121> which thou shalt have, after thou hast lost <WH7923> the other, shall say <WH559> again in thine ears <WH241>, The place <WH4725> is too strait <WH6862> for me: give <WH5066> place <WH4725> to me that I may dwell <WH3427>.

Then shalt thou say <WH559> in thine heart <WH3824>, Who hath begotten <WH3205> me these, seeing I have lost my children <WH7921>, and am desolate <WH1565>, a captive <WH1540>, and removing to and fro <WH5493>? and who hath brought up <WH1431> these? Behold, I was left <WH7604> alone; these, where <WH375> had they been?

Thus saith <WH559> the Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069>, Behold, I will lift up <WH5375> mine hand <WH3027> to the Gentiles <WH1471>, and set up <WH7311> my standard <WH5251> to the people <WH5971>: and they shall bring <WH935> thy sons <WH1121> in their arms <WH2684>, and thy daughters <WH1323> shall be carried <WH5375> upon their shoulders <WH3802>. arms: Heb. bosom

And kings <WH4428> shall be thy nursing fathers <WH539>, and their queens <WH8282> thy nursing mothers <WH3243>: they shall bow down <WH7812> to thee with their face <WH639> toward the earth <WH776>, and lick up <WH3897> the dust <WH6083> of thy feet <WH7272>; and thou shalt know <WH3045> that I am the LORD <WH3068>: for they shall not be ashamed <WH954> that wait <WH6960> for me. nursing fathers: Heb. nourishers queens: Heb. princesses
Shall the prey <WH4455> be taken <WH3947> from the mighty <WH1368>, or the lawful <WH6662> captive <WH7628> delivered <WH4422>? lawful: Heb. captivity of the just

But thus saith <WH559> the LORD <WH3068>, Even the captives <WH7628> of the mighty <WH1368> shall be taken away <WH3947>, and the prey <WH4455> of the terrible <WH6184> shall be delivered <WH4422>: for I will contend <WH7378> with him that contendeth <WH3401> with thee, and I will save <WH3467> thy children <WH1121>. captives: Heb. captivity

And I will feed <WH398> them that oppress <WH3238> thee with their own flesh <WH1320>; and they shall be drunken <WH7937> with their own blood <WH1818>, as with sweet wine <WH6071>: and all flesh <WH1320> shall know <WH3045> that I the LORD <WH3068> am thy Saviour <WH3467> and thy Redeemer <WH1350>, the mighty One <WH46> of Jacob <WH3290>. sweet: or, new
